titleStmt.title: True intelligence from the vvest: or A true relation of the desperate proceedings of the rebels, and cavaliers gathered together at Angry-Fisherton in Wilt-Sheire. With their barbarous cruelty exercised on the minister, his wife and child. Also, the manner of their falling upon some party of the Parliament forces, some of them departing wounded. Written by a gentleman of good quallity in the said town, and published for satisfaction of all those that desire true information.
titleStmt.author: A Gentleman of Good Quallity.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
